titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Carolyn Jordan Papers, 1964-1983 and undated
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: The papers of Carolyn Jordan, a former Lubbock city council member and president of the League of Women Voters of Lubbock.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Carolyn Jordan was elected to the Lubbock, Texas, City Council, as well as serving as president of the South Plains Association of Governments (1974-1975) and president of the League of Women Voters of Lubbock.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection bulks with correspondence, minutes of city council meetings, financial reports, and reports on projects and special interests. Also included are files relating to the South Plains Association of Governments (SPAG), the National Association of Regional Councils, South Plains Health Systems, Texas Association of Regional Councils and the Texas Municipal League.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Carolyn Jordan Papers, 1964-1983 and undated, 1946-1988, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas

relatedmaterial.p: For related materials located in the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, see the following collections:

list.item: Carolyn Jordan oral history interview [sound recording], 1986
